feedback_text: This course set a very high standard. The grading is tough, but it ensures a strong grasp of fundamentals. Highly recommended.
observation: The course has a high standard and tough grading, but it ensures a strong grasp of fundamentals.

feedback_text: I feel frustrated because the grading criteria are unclear and seem arbitrary. I need more transparency in how grades are determined so I can understand my performance better. Could you share a detailed rubric or examples of graded work to help me see the expectations?
observation: The student states that grading criteria are unclear and appear arbitrary, and requests more transparency.
need: clarity and transparency in grading to understand performance better
request: Share a detailed rubric or examples of graded work that illustrate the expectations.

feedback_text: I have been struggling with this course and feel that the grading system is unclear to me. I would appreciate a detailed explanation of how grades are determined and specific feedback on my assignments so that I can understand what is expected and improve my performance. Thank you for your support
observation: The student has been struggling with the course and finds the grading system unclear.
need: clarity and constructive guidance on grading and assignments
request: a detailed explanation of how grades are determined and specific feedback on assignments to improve performance

feedback_text: Overall an okay course, but grading could be improved to better reflect student understanding
observation: The course was described as generally acceptable, but the grading system is seen as not fully reflecting student understanding.
feeling: Slight dissatisfaction or concern about grading fairness
need: Accurate and fair assessment that aligns with students' demonstrated knowledge
request: Revise grading criteria or provide clearer feedback to better match student understanding

feedback_text: I noticed that the grading in this course seems to be influenced by the specific TAs assigned, which makes me feel concerned about fairness. I need a grading process that accurately reflects student understanding. Could we consider having each assignment graded by several TAs, rotating them so that no single TA consistently grades the same students, and then averaging those scores? This would help ensure fairness for all students
observation: The student observed that grading appears to be influenced by specific TAs and suggested rotating multiple TAs per assignment.
need: fairness in grading that accurately reflects student understanding
request: Rotate multiple TAs to grade each assignment and average their scores to ensure fairness for all students
